content.name: User Experience and Interaction Design (BS)
content.description: The User Experience and Interaction Design (UXID) degree gives you the tools to not only understand technology, but also the human principles underpinning it.

contents.name: UI Design
contents.description: In the first year, you learn user interface (UI) design, which is the focus on the graphical look and feel of apps and websites. Color, spacing, and typography is key.

contents.name: Web Development
contents.description: In the second year, you learn the how to code the designs you create. HTML, CSS, JavaScript, are the core languages that allow you to build a competitive portfolio.

content.description: Students in UXID get 3 individual 6-month co-op cycles, which allows for a year and a half of working experience before graduation.

stat_1.description: Employed at a full-time job within one year of graduation

stat_2.description: Average salary within one year of graduation
